metadata.synopsis: When an in-flight collision incapacitates the pilots of an airplane bound for Los Angeles, stewardess Nancy Pryor (Karen Black) is forced to take over the controls. From the ground, her boyfriend Alan Murdock (Charlton Heston), a retired test pilot, tries to talk her through piloting and landing the 747 aircraft. Worse yet, the anxious passengers -- among which are a noisy nun (Helen Reddy) and a cranky man (Sid Caesar) -- are aggravating the already tense atmosphere.

reviews: There's nothing wrong with good old-fashioned disaster thrillers. Unfortunately, [Airport 1975] doesn't deliver.
It isn't art, it isn't even pop art, but popcorn art, so bad that it's almost good, a lot funnier than Airport (though I suspect It wasn't meant to be).
A film that's so outlandish, it almost becomes a self-parody.
Airport 1975 is good, exciting, corny escapism and the kind of movie you would not want to watch as an in-flight film.
Another sequel that should have been grounded.
The best of the "Airport" sequels, though that's hardly a glowing recommendation.
